name: The Modern
address: 9 W 53rd St, New York, NY 10019, USA

reviews.text: Came here for anniversary with my boyfriend and was surprised by how great the food was. Definitely worth spending your money here if you have something special to celebrate!!!

We had the abstractions menu however many courses are bit too salty. The richness of flavors is appreciated in every dish but the flavors are all very strong and less coordinative or soothing. Also there were two dessert courses followed by a free offering of chocolate tasting which felt too much for dessert.

The service was excellent and professional though.

This is my second visitâ€”my first was back in 2016.

The place has stayed much the same: elegant, with that refined MOMA-like atmosphere. Whatâ€™s changed is me. I no longer get swept up in the presentation; I care more about the actual flavors.

This time around, Iâ€™d say most of the dishes were good, but the main courseâ€”steak and lobsterâ€”felt lackluster, borderline mediocre. The wine pairing had its moments: a few excellent choices, but some were questionable. Still, for under $200, I canâ€™t complain too much.

Would I return for the Michelin stars alone? Definitely not.
But would I come back for a relaxed dinner or a date night? Absolutely.

Booooo!!!!  Everything was fine until I needed to use the restroom. It's disgusting â€” men and women share the same space, with only a few small individual stalls (about the size of airplane restrooms) lined up in a row. When you step out, you immediately face someone of the opposite gender using the mirrors, which creates an awkward and confusing situation for everyone. Thereâ€™s no real privacy, and the setup feels completely inappropriate. Honestly, it was unacceptable.

Our group had a truly excellent dinner experience at The Modern this evening. The food was exceptionally memorable, and our server Abby was absolutely the "cherry on top" of our experience. She artfully guided us to the most exquisite dishes of the evening (the lamb and the cherry meringue sundae), and took our experience from wonderful to unforgettable. I'm very much looking forward to returning to experience the tasting menu on our next visit!
Highly recommend. The flavor profiles were incredible. Service was impeccable. It was a memorable experience.

Great food experience with excellent wine choices!

We just returned for our third visit and it was fully excellent.  Amazing seasonal menu changes, great wine service, and fully satisfying.  Special thanks to our excellent sommelier, Jienna!!

Meal was a 10/10

This is now my favorite fine dining in the city

Many great restaurants have a few standout dishes. This place consistently had amazing dishes. I consider each a 9 or 10

Our sommelier was incredibly friendly. Spent a lot of time learning about her experience in wine and got to learn about what makes the modernâ€™s wine collection special

The restaurant did not feel stuffy but service was great.

I will be back to try the bar room soon
Good food. Overpriced as all museum restaurants! The tuna salad sandwich was  good. The quiche was dry. The wait staff were very friendly.
Just excellent! We had lunch at the bar. Food is great. Service is perfect. A great spot for a nice lunch after MoMA

I came up to NYC for the weekend to celebrate my wedding anniversary with my wife, and as part of our tradition, my wife and I try to visit as many Michelin-starred restaurants as we can reasonably fit into our plans. The Modern had been on our list for a while, and Iâ€™ll say upfront, this was one of the more difficult places to rate.
Letâ€™s start with the positives. The space itself is gorgeous! Sleek, modern, and perfectly in line with its name. We had some rain that evening, which dulled the view a bit, but thatâ€™s no fault of the restaurant. The food, however, was exceptional. They opened strong with a soup that was rich and balanced, and the courses that followed kept up the momentum (such as their Eggs on Eggs on Eggs picture attached). Each dish was thoughtful, beautifully plated, and full of flavor. Itâ€™s clear the kitchen knows what itâ€™s doing.
Service was also excellent. The staff knew it was our anniversary and made a genuine effort to make the evening feel special. They were attentive without hovering, and the pacing of the meal was spot on.
Now, hereâ€™s where things got complicated. Toward the end of our meal, just before dessert, a party of six was seated nearby. Normally, I wouldnâ€™t bat an eye as people come and go, and everyone deserves a great meal. But this group felt completely out of sync with the atmosphere. Two were dressed in suits, two in business casual, and two in jeans and hoodies. Again, Iâ€™m not one to judge attire too harshly, but what really threw us was their behavior. They were loud, disruptive, and most surprisingly they started playing cards at the table. In a fine dining setting, thatâ€™s just not something you expect or want to navigate while finishing a carefully curated tasting menu.
We still had a lovely evening overall, and the food truly was memorable. But I hope future guests get to enjoy The Modern without having to plan around impromptu card games at neighboring tables.

I had an incredible experience at The Modern! My favorite dish was eggs on eggs on eggs, but every course was good. Service was friendly, attentive, and accommodating.

I paid $354 in total with tax and tip for the abstractions menu with no drinks besides water.

I ate at Per Se in March, and I'd probably recommend The Modern over Per Se. Both were great, but The Modern is cheaper and an easier reservation to get.

Favorite lunch menu so far, service was excellent and food was delicious.

Reasonably priced in a nice environment. Would come back again!

Had a 3 course tasting menu.
Came away feeling I got a  1-star experience at a 2 star price.
The Michelin Guide awards 2 stars to restaurants offering "excellent cooking, worth a detour" but I found that the cuisine was not better than at any 1-star restaurant I've been to.
The crab meat Amuse-buoche looked interesting but the flavors were sadly anemic.
The kanpachi and summer squash first course, a beautiful presentation, was the best in the meal, with a nice texture contrast
Yet it too did not ascend, in flavors and technique, to "excellent".
The sweet corn ravioli with french breakfast radish main course suffered from the same lackluster quality - good technique, good flavors, barely a 1 star level offering.
So too was the chocolate opera cake dessert - tasty yet underwhelming.
I feel the second Michelin star is unwarranted and in terms of value for money - I paid a premium for lunch with a nice view of the MoMA sculpture garden but the kitchen did not deliver a matching level of cuisine.

Coming from Australia, we don't yet have any Michelin rated restaurants. Michelin hasn't visited??!! We do have many fine locally "Hatted" restaurants in both Australia and New Zealand.
A few I have sampled

While visiting NYC this October, wanted to take the opportunity to sample a few Michelin starred restaurants to compare

While the ambience and food are unlike the many fine dinning restaurants I am used to back in Australia / New Zealand, the Modern is a very good different. Local fare, local ingredients

The Caviar Hot Dogs. Playful, delectable and indulgent in a beautiful bite sized package. Only in America ğŸ˜€

The Scollop dish with the beans - very American and showcases Americana wonderfully

The Hazelnut dessert with the layered chocolate flakes. Also so deliciously American

The wine pairings were also wonderful and did lift the flavour profiles of each dish

In all, had a thoroughly delightful and enjoyable evening here. Big shout out to my server Esteban and his colleagues who took great care to look after a solo diner like myself who can usually get lost in a crowd but not at The Modern ğŸ˜

I would definitely come back - next time I am in Manhattan again - and highly recommend The Modern for all especially if you are looking for a fun, fresh and contemporary dinning experience

Wonderful birthday dinner at The Modern with a close friend. What an awesome experience. We chose the impressions menu and the food was beautiful, delicious and each dish was well crafted. Highlights were the crab-avocado first course, squash soup with morels, turbot with lobster bisque and sabayon, heritage chicken and the dessert (ok - so basically all of it :)). We opted for cocktails instead of wine - The Modern was exceptional. And all of it elevated into a wonderful experience by our server, Antu (and all of the staff). We shared how wonderful it was and got to go back to the kitchen to meet the chef and her entire team - that was pretty special.

Took the train up to celebrate a day & night out for a birthday of a friend who loves good food.  Hands down the best tasting menu I've had in 3-4 years. Every course was beautifully composed and nuanced, with unexpected surprises tucked into each dish that delighted the curious mind. As a biochemist, I was particularly pleased by the excitement and willingness of the knowledgeable staff to explain how specific textures and tastes were constructed from a clever mix of simple and complex ingredients. The kampache hit the spot, as did the pumpkin decoction accompanying it with little sesame crunches. The Modern Martini was a masterful blend by a clearly talented bartender. We were seated by the garden and the noise level was perfect - we could chat & catch up over nearly 3 hrs with lots of laughter. A hand written thank you note to the Chef earned us a surprise visit to the Kitchen, which capped off a perfect day in the city. Thanks to the staff for an excellent time. We will definitely be back!
just ok
Had some great drinks, the tasting menu or 5 course forget at the moment, all the courses were great but the main course was just ok. Wish it included entrance into the museum.
Wonderful experience. Everything was top notch from the moment we entered. Outstanding staff and food. A must go. Highly recommend.
I would give it 10 stars if I could. I went for lunch and was blown away. Special thanks to Stephen and Paul. Impecable service and surprises. I canâ€™t wait to go back!!!
Iâ€™m a driver for a private client and out of most high profile restaurants, this is their favorite. They say the soups are the best!!

MoMA is my favorite NYC institution, and I've been dying to check out The Modern ever since I learned of its existence, but would you believe that no one ever wants to spend $200+ to experience it with me?

Pffft. Plebs.

Well, I finally got my wish when relatives came to visit. We opted for the Impressions menu as it had more of what we wanted.

- Smoked sturgeon and cucumber tart: Perfectly baked, and as savory and refreshing as one would expect for this kind of opener.

- Avocado and summer squash with cara cara orange and basil: Beautifully plated and as refreshing as, well, a summer salad. The cara caras were a nice touch.

- Sunflower sourdough with cultured butter + Turbot cooked on the bone with sweet corn and lovage: These came together, presumably so one had something to sop up the lovely turbot sauce with. The sourdough was crisp and chewy, and the fish was perfectly tender with lots of maize flavor. Lovely.

- Roasted maine lobster with maitakes and meyer lemons vs. Venison glazed in cognac with sweet prince tomatoes and jamon iberico: Half of our party opted for the lobster, while the other half got venison, allowing us to try both. I was Team Lobster and definitely made the right choice, from the juicy, crunchy crustacean itself to the equally juicy, crunchy shrooms. Mmmm. The venison will undoubtedly appease manly red meat lovers, but I'm so over the "seared meat course" on every tasting menu.

- Milk chocolate ganache with mint and shiso ice cream: A simple but satisfying dessert with surprisingly not too sweet ganache. The real star was the ice-cream though, because I've rarely found shiso ice-cream anywhere (even in Japan), and considering it's one of my favorite herbs....Let's just say I *MIGHT* have licked my plate. Might.

We also received a complimentary white chocolate and lemon mini-cake for celebrating a special occasion. It was delectably spongey and large enough for the whole table to share. The final petit fours were a nice touch as well: an mandarin chocolate truffle and guava-jasmine gelatin.

For drinky drinks, we got the fruity Jungle Bird and zesty Spiced Pina, but their cocktail and wine list will likely impress even the pickiest drinkers, given this is a two Michelin-starred restaurant.

Service was as attentive as one would also expect for such a starred restaurant, but not so overly obsequious that I felt like I'd been recently knighted. I actually felt the decor was a bit lacking for a modern art museum restaurant--they could use a few unique statues and paintings a la Robert above the Museum of Arts and Design. And the sculpture park wasn't lit up when we were there, so that was boring to behold too.

All in all, glad I (finally) tried this. For the most part, it lived up to the fantasies.

It's been six years since my last visit, and I'm every bit as delighted as my first time. They've met all my expectations, and I've said it a hundred times that "The Modern" sets the standard for how Michelin rated restaurants SHOULD perform. To this day, there is no equal.

The Modern is absolutely exceptional! The food is refined and creative, with every dish perfectly balanced and beautifully presented. The atmosphere is elegant but comfortable, and the view of MoMAâ€™s sculpture garden adds a special touch. The service is flawless â€” professional, warm, and attentive. Whether youâ€™re celebrating something special or just want a top-tier dining experience, The Modern never disappoints.

The food here was pretty unremarkable. I don't know if it's because it was a Restaurant Week menu or what it was. I've been to Michelin-starred restaurants in NY and abroad and I'm surprised this restaurant got even one star, unless they are just grading the service now and the food doesn't matter. The crab appetizer was in a  barely-interesting curry. The octopus and pork belly were so mismatched in texture and flavor that it was almost surprising. The sundae dessert was the opposite of what I asked the server to recommend, which was something with more acidity as a palate cleanser. I could barely eat a third of it because it was so rich--and salty! You can have better versions of the crab, octopus and pork belly at so many other places in New York. The same goes for the dessert, which was more salty than sweet.

The food was absolutely incredible and the menu was very thoughtfully curated. The staff was always the same, any question we had was expertly answered with kindness. We had such an amazing visit that weâ€™re planning on stopping in every time we visit the city!
Didn't expect a museum affiliated restaurant to do so well, but the food was so rich and the service impeccable. Shouldn't have ordered the dessert though lol.

We had a memorable experience at The Modern. The food, atmosphere and service were top excellent.
Our server Allegra was knowledgeable, fun and on point all evening.
The room is airy, modern and beautiful.
The food is delicious and beautifully presented.
The eggs on eggs on eggs was the highlight. Full of flavour with a unique and pleasing presentation.
We enjoyed the 7 course meal with wine pairings. Itâ€™s the way to go as adding the eggs on eggs dish is an extra $75 anyway and you have to try it.
If youâ€™re in NYC and have a healthy budget The Modern is an excellent option. It definitely stands up to its 2 star Michelin status.

To die for !!!! I had some good memories of this restaurant and just went there to have a quick bite !!!! And that was simply amazing to quote one of the waitresses- had a fricassÃ©e of squid and mushrooms together with a cherry Sunday
Simply unbelievable and with a wonderful view on Picasso, Moore or Dubuffet sculptures
Very nice service
A piece of Heaven in NYC (and that is needed)
The best surprise of the month
MERCI BEAUCOUP
Food was amazing. The most exquisite seasonable ingredients!grat experience

This place impresses consistently! Their employees combine warmth with careful observation. Make room for their signature specialties. The dishes please while the service exceeds expectations. Good food and helpful service. We'll visit again!

The kitchen team here cooks with both skill and heart. We ordered just a few items, which were satisfactory. You get warm service, tasty food, and generous serving sizes here. Welcoming team, excellent meals, and fun vicinity! This restaurant satisfies curious food lovers.
Wine pairing is perfect!!!

å…¨ã¦ãŒç´ æ™´ã‚‰ã—ã‹ã£ãŸã§ã™ã€‚
è‹±èªãŒå¾—æ„ã§ã¯ãªã„æˆ‘ã€…ã«ã‚‚ä¸å¯§ã«æ¥ã—ã¦ä¸‹ã•ã‚Šã€ç‰¹åˆ¥ãªæ™‚é–“ã‚’éã”ã™ã“ã¨ãŒå‡ºæ¥ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚
å¿ƒã‹ã‚‰æ„Ÿè¬ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚
Drinks, food and staff are excellent!

Tremendous experience at the modern.  Had the full tasting menu and it was spectacular. On top of that, the wait staff were unbelievable, so kind and attentive, we actually got a quick kitchen tour before we left!  And the eggs on eggs on eggs dish was unforgettable, cannot recommend enough.
Weâ€™re from Texas and had dinner here recently. Steve Vera took care of our tableâ€”friendly, funny, and very informative. The food was amazing! Highly recommend a visit.
Sat in the kitchen. It was amazing! Better than some of the 3 Michelin star restaurants Iâ€™ve been to.

Unfortunately not quite up to standards as a 2* Michelin restaurant should be - the food was good, but not great. No dish was inherently bad or a â€œmissâ€, but it just consistently felt a little short of other 2* quality restaurants Iâ€™ve been to.

The service is phenomenal and the wine pairing was great. But the food itself didnâ€™t quite hit the mark and felt like it was consistently just below expectations for what the quality is typically at for a restaurant of this level. It wasnâ€™t any one thing in particular was is unfortunate. Some dishes it was a lack of seasoning, others it was an over-emphasis of a given ingredient. I think The Modern is close to being great, but needs to perhaps refine the current menu a bit.

The food was culinary perfection in terms of flavor and presentation.  The service was professional and dignified, while being warm and friendly.  The ambiance was a masterpiece of modern art.  I cannot wait to return.

Nice lunch value prix fixe (until you sup the eggs dish)- which is worth it and a must. Eggs on eggs on eggs is one of those quintessential fine dining dishes that must be experienced at least once. Great service, unbelievable views of the outdoor MoMA sculpture garden.

We had a lovely evening at this restaurant and honestly cannot believe it isnâ€™t raved about more often, especially as a 2 star. From start to finish, the entire experience was great.

The wine program in particular deserves a spotlight. Jenna, the sommelier (originally from California, if I remember her name correctly I hope), was phenomenal. She didnâ€™t just recommend wines, she took the time to talk through the selections, explain the pairings, and guide us toward wine that complemented our dishes perfectly. Her knowledge was impressive, but what stood out even more was how approachable and genuine she was. Sometimes wine service can feel stiff, but Jennaâ€™s enthusiasm and down-to-earth personality made it fun, engaging, and really added to the evening.
Our server was just as wonderful, warm, friendly, and attentive without ever being overbearing. She had a natural ease, and it was clear she genuinely cared about making sure we were enjoying ourselves. The supporting wait staff also played a big role in the seamless service, assisting quickly and thoughtfully whenever needed.

As for the food, every dish was presented nicely and mostly all very flavorful. Each course felt carefully prepared, and when paired with the wines Jenna (really hope this is her name!) suggested, the flavors truly came alive. Itâ€™s rare to find a spot where the food, wine, and service are all in harmony, but this restaurant delivered.

Weâ€™re already looking forward to returning and recommend it, whether youâ€™re celebrating something special or just want an evening of good food and wine in a welcoming atmosphere.

Such a great experience! We had an early dinner, at the outdoor garden, overlooking the sculpture garden. The food was spectacular but above all - the service was impeccable! Our sever John was very kind and patient, explaining us the different options we had with all our dietary restrictions. We thought it would be a quick dinner but ended up staying for almost for 3 hours.

We had an amazing time! All the staff were great, we had Allerga as our main waitress and she was particularly incredible. Getting to meet the entire kitchen staff was a really special moment and we would definitely recommend to anyone. An unforgettable night out!!

Mixed feelings about this restaurant. Not that special as we expected. Interior is modern, white... not warm and cozy. My husband doesn't eat meat and milk products, his lobster was with pesto...far from creatief and special.
Egs on ags were lovely. And champagne was great.
Unforgettable experience. Will definitely come again. Came here with my partner and we left happy, full, and with great memories of the delightful food and experience!

Exceeded expectations! We dined at the Chefs Table  and were blown away by the atmosphere. It is so cool to be present inside the kitchen and witness the magic happen. Food and service were incredible,  great cocktails. Meeting Thomas Allan and a group photo added such a nice touch to the beautiful evening. Experience we wonâ€™t forget.

Food was amazing. The most exquisite seasonable ingredients. Service was impeccable and the restaurant was so accommodating on my multiple food restrictions (pregnant with gestational diabetes). We celebrated my husbandâ€™s  birthday here and had such a memorable and lovely one!! Weâ€™re already planning to come back for the kitchen table experience with friends!

This was my first time visiting the restaurant, and I reserved a seat for one. The server arranged a very spacious sofa seat by the window, offering a great view of the garden.

I ordered the three course prix fixe menu, with wine pairing. The staff were very friendly and gentle, and the dishes were impressive. The main course,roasted lamb with sour cherries, watercress and eggplant was particularly amazing; even towards the end, the meat remained incredibly tender. The wines paired with the dishes were all very well chosen, especially the Ngeringa Syrah 2022 paired with the lamb, which complemented the cherry and blackberry aromas along with the smoky finish, matching the lamb perfectly.

The dessert was roasted peaches, cheesecake mousse, and tarragon, paired with CuvÃ©e Thibault JuranÃ§on Moelleux Petit Manseng. Both the dessert and CuvÃ©e Thibault were excellent individually. Drinking the wine on its own allowed me to truly appreciate its flavor, but unfortunately, the sweetness of both the dessert and the wine paired well at first, but as the sweetness built up, it became hard to discern the evolving flavors of the dessert or the wine. I believe if this dessert were paired with a high-mountain tea from Asia, it would have had a more distinct expression.

Another disappointment was that, to balance the sweetness of the wine and dessert, I ordered a pot of Darjeeling tea. Unfortunately, this cup of tea didnâ€™t seem to meet the standards one would expect from a restaurant of this caliber. The tea had a very faint aroma and was bitter from the very first sip, becoming even more unpleasant and difficult to drink towards the end.

However, overall, itâ€™s still a restaurant well worth visiting, and I hope to return next time to try different flavors in another season.

Hands down one of the top three restaurants Iâ€™ve dined at so far this year. Every single out plate of this kitchen was spectacular, truly amazing! Way exceeded my expectations. Well deserved itâ€™s coveted 2 Michelin star

Beautiful atmosphere. Exceptional flavors. Accommodating to vegan though omitting the protein (lobster in my case) made the plate of plants seem slightly less value for money. Service and quality made up for that. Gorgeous and low key spot for a fine dining lunch. Seasonally driven high quality food.
